content:
Secondary Teacher CPD https://www2.le.ac.uk This page provides an overview of all future Education CPD+ events for Secondary School Teachers. daily 1 2015-01-21T04:49:50Z Literacy in Science https://www2.le.ac.uk/departments/education/cpd-for-teachers/our-cpd-sessions/session-information/literacy-in-science ASE - Region 16 Event, administered by Education CPD+ Book Now

Did you know that it is estimated that you need to learn as many subject specific words in science as to speak a foreign language? As well as teaching the science concepts you need to provide opportunities for pupils to reinforce and use the vocabulary. This meeting will be hosted by 2 speakers considering this aspect of our teaching.

Everyone booking in advance will receive a FREE BOOK Sessions

\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Ed Walsh - Ed is always a popular presenter. " anything Ed does is worth going to" - details of this session will be posted asap . Change of speaker due to illness, but we are delighted to welcome Ed to the Region, and feel sure you will want to go to more of his sessions in Birmingham at the next annual Conference next year!

\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd William Hirst - author of best-selling science dictionary "William's Words", in a hands-on workshop in which he shares his ideas for boosting literacy through science teaching. William has written a series of resources promoting literacy, the strategies in which are ideal for learners of all ages and abilities. In his workshop William will explain how to improve literacy through your own teaching and you will get the opportunity to try out from of his ideas. FREE Book (to those who book early)

\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Primary: STAR SCIENCE \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd boosting literacy using Michael Rosen\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Poems,

\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Secondary: Williams Book of Words \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd science dictionary\ufffd\ufffd

To book onto this session you can book and pay online using card with Shop@le. Or you can fill out our online booking form, call 0116 252 3771\ufffd\ufffdand email educationcpd@le.ac.uk\ufffd\ufffdto be invoiced.


Code: RC223C09
Audience: KS 1, 2, 3, 4. Students, ITE tutors, TAs. (not just for Primary Science co-ordinators, but other primary teachers too).
Duration: 1/2 day
Cost: Members \ufffd\ufffd25, Non-members \ufffd\ufffd50. Students: (no book) members \ufffd\ufffd11, non-members \ufffd\ufffd20. Group booking: If others come from the same school and are booked together, it is \ufffd\ufffd12 for each additional person (one book will be given to the school group - if applicable).

All times and details of a session are given as a guide only. Education CPD+ reserves the right to amend these details where circumstances dictate.

]]> No publisher ad357 ECPD_Primary ECPD_Secondary 2015-03-21T09:00:00Z Event Preparing for the new Secondary Science Curriculum https://www2.le.ac.uk/departments/education/cpd-for-teachers/our-cpd-sessions/session-information/preparing-for-the-new-secondary-science-curriculum Developing effective schemes and assessments as the curriculum changes. RC223C09: Secondary Book Here

This course will support science teachers in implementing the new National Curriculum.

You will identify the key issues arising from the new Curriculum and consider how to audit and adapt existing schemes of learning to accommodate the changes.

Outcomes:

\ufffd\ufffd

  • describe key issues arising from changes to the Curriculum and their implications
  • plan and evaluate ways of embedding the new Curriculum in schemes of learning

Impact Awards

Impact Award bursary from the Department for Education may be available toward the cost of this CPD for teachers or technicians. Applicants must be employed in a state funded secondary school or college, including maintained schools, academies and free schools.\ufffd\ufffdFind out more

To book onto this session, use the online booking form provided by the Science Learning Centre. Click here to book.


Code: RC223C09
Audience: Advanced Skills Teachers, Heads of Science, Science Coordinators/Leaders, Secondary Teachers
Trainer: David Shakespeare
Duration: 1 day
Cost: \ufffd\ufffd210*, \ufffd\ufffd410 (non-maintained) Impact Awards available

All times and details of a session are given as a guide only. Education CPD+ reserves the right to amend these details where circumstances dictate.

]]> No publisher ad357 ECPD_Secondary Education CPD+ 2015-03-23T09:00:00Z Event Preparing for the New Science Curriculum KS4- Linear Assessment https://www2.le.ac.uk/departments/education/cpd-for-teachers/our-cpd-sessions/session-information/preparing-for-the-new-science-curriculum-ks4-linear-assessment Support and guidance for teachers on teaching the new national curriculum in Science. This course will support science teachers in implementing the new National Curriculum. You will identify the key issues arising from the new Curriculum and consider how to audit and adapt existing schemes of learning to accommodate the changes.

]]> No publisher hr111 ECPD_Secondary 2015-06-19T08:30:00Z Event Teaching Creative Writing at Post-16 https://www2.le.ac.uk/departments/education/cpd-for-teachers/our-cpd-sessions/session-information/teaching-creative-writing-at-post-16 For Teachers Who Write (Or Want to Write), with the critically acclaimed poet Daljit Nagra. Suitable for:
  • Teachers of the creative writing A-level
  • Writers who want to teach
  • Tutors of creative writing

About the course:

The course will help you to develop your own writing craft, reflect on your practice and tackle pedagogical challenges presented by teaching creative writing. There will be workshops, seminars and individual tutorials, and talks by authors about their experience of translating good writing practice into great teaching practice. You will be given access to the Resource Bank for continued support throughout the teaching year.

Venue:

The course will take place on the University of Leicester\ufffd\ufffdmain campus (LE1 7RH) approximately half a mile from Leicester train station. The dinner and overnight accommodation is at the University\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds new conference centre College Court (LE2 3TQ) approximately one mile from the campus.

Fees:

  • \ufffd\ufffd375 standard non-residential
  • \ufffd\ufffd445 residential (inc overnight bed & breakfast on 6 July)
  • \ufffd\ufffd195 self-employed or hourly paid (non-residential) NB evidence required

Course tutors:

Designed and delivered by the University\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Centre for\ufffd\ufffdNew Writing, the course will be taught by experienced writers and A-level exam board representatives. There will be plenty of time to get to know your tutors and each other. The acclaimed poet Daljit Nagra will give a reading and answer your questions at the evening dinner on Monday 6 July. Daljit is a poet and teacher whose
works include Look We Have Coming to Dover!

Enquiries:

For full details click here.
Please email Elizabeth-Anne Grummitt, School of English with enquiries: eg205@leicester.ac.uk
]]> No publisher ad357 ECPD_Secondary 2015-07-06T08:30:00Z Event
